title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file. There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty models, and the computer shuts down/reboots immediately.
EB: When a WSWB session is open with opened, dirty .txt file(s) and the user attempts to shut down the system, a warning or question message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their changes before the computer shuts down/reboots.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down…' command to shut down/reboot the computer.

Expected result: A warning or question message box should pop up, allowing users to save their dirty models before the computer shuts down/reboots.
